intro: Pultenaea virgata, commonly known as the slender bushwillow, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions. Pultenaea virgata is also valued for its role in supporting local wildlife, particularly insects and birds.
